revised_title: Cyanogenesis in Flax: The Discovery of Phaseolunatin in Linum usitatissimum
tldr: Researchers discovered that flax plants contain a cyanogenetic glucoside called phaseolunatin, which is similar to the glucoside found in Phaseolus lunatus seeds. The study found that the amount of phaseolunatin in flax plants increases with germination and reaches a maximum at an early stage of growth before decreasing. This research helps to understand the process of cyanogenesis in flax plants and the role of phaseolunatin in their growth.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biochemistry
